title: Which Factors are associated with Open Access Publishing? A Springer Nature Case Study. (arXiv:2208.08221v3 [cs.DL] UPDATED)
abstract: Open Access (OA) facilitates access to articles. But, authors or funders often must pay the publishing costs preventing authors who do not receive financial support from participating in OA publishing and citation advantage for OA articles. OA may exacerbate existing inequalities in the publication system rather than overcome them. To investigate this, we studied 522,411 articles published by Springer Nature. Employing correlation and regression analyses, we describe the relationship between authors affiliated with countries from different income levels, their choice of publishing model, and the citation impact of their papers. A machine learning classification method helped us to explore the importance of different features in predicting the publishing model. tldr: 该论文研究了522,411篇Springer Nature发表的文章，发现有资格获得APC豁免的作者更倾向于在金色开放获取期刊上发表论文，而有资格获得APC折扣的作者发表开放获取文章的比例最低。
